page.topic: How to Define a Hyperlink in a Client-side Template
page.description: Client-side template syntax is used in Lists, FormView, and ViewBox controls to define the control's layout. If you want to include hyperlink in the template definition, you must stop the hyperlink HTML element's click event from bubbling up to the top-level control.

section.description: There are two ways to add hyperlinks to the HTML markup you define for the client-side template:

item.name: a5-item
item.description: Using the special *[ui:a5-item]* attribute in the hyperlink HTML (these are called Template *[ui:items]*.)

item.name: event handlers
item.description: Add event handlers (eg, *[js:onclick]*, *[js:ontouchstart]*, etc) to the hyperlink HTML.

case.title: Defining an a5-item in a List Control

step.description: Click the *[ui:Template 'items']* hyperlink on the *[ui:List Layout]* tab and select *[ui:Define/edit template items]* to open the *[ui:Define Items]* dialog to define a new Template *[ui:Item]*.

figure.title: Click the "Define/edit template items" option to create new or edit existing Items.

description.p: In the *[ui:Define Items]* dialog, click the *[ui:Add Item]* button to add a new a5-item. Give the item a unique *[ui:Item name]*. This name will be referenced in your client-side template in the *[js:a5-item]* property.

section.title: Adding Event Handlers to the Hyperlink HTML

description.p: In order to add hyperlinks to the HTML markup that you define for a client-side template in a List, FormView, or ViewBox control, you need to add special event handlers to tha anchor tag's *[js:onclick]* and *[ui:ontouchstart]* events to prevent the event from bubbling up to the control itself. Otherwise, the control will handle the event and ignore the hyperlink.
